facts.1: International Asteroid Day is observed on June 30th to raise awareness about asteroids and their potential impact on Earth.
facts.2: The date commemorates the Tunguska event, the largest asteroid impact on Earth in recorded history, which occurred on June 30, 1908.
facts.3: Asteroid Day was co-founded by astrophysicist and musician Dr. Brian May, who is also the lead guitarist of the rock band Queen.

facts.1: Social Media Day is celebrated on June 30th to recognize the impact of social media on global communication.
facts.2: The day was launched by Mashable in 2010 to highlight the ways social media has revolutionized how we interact and share information.
facts.3: Social Media Day events and meetups are held worldwide to bring together social media enthusiasts and professionals.

facts.1: National Meteor Watch Day is observed on June 30th to encourage people to go outside and watch for meteors, also known as shooting stars.
facts.2: Meteors are small particles from space that burn up upon entering Earth's atmosphere, creating a streak of light.
facts.3: The best time to watch for meteors is during a meteor shower, which occurs when Earth passes through the debris trail of a comet.
